competencies.name: Reasoning and Analyzing
competencies.description: Figuring things out and understanding why things happen

indicators.name: Solve problems successfully.
Understand why things happen.

competencies.name: Understanding and Solving
competencies.description: Making sense of problems and finding solutions

indicators.name: Think through problems.
Come up with realistic solutions.

competencies.name: Connecting and Reflecting
competencies.description: Making connections between ideas and thinking about what you learned

indicators.name: Skillfully link ideas together.
Reflect on what I’ve learned.

competencies.name: Comprehend and Connect
competencies.description: Understanding what you read, hear, or see and making connections to what you already know

indicators.name: Understand what I read, hear, or see.
Connect it to what I already know.

competencies.name: Create and Communicate
competencies.description: Using words, writing, speaking, or creating pictures or other things to share your thoughts and ideas clearly with others

indicators.name: Use words, writing, speaking or creating visuals effectively.
Share thoughts and ideas clearly.

competencies.name: Thinking and Communicating
competencies.description: Using your brain to understand things and then telling others about it

indicators.name: Fully understand things.
Explain them to others.

competencies.name: Personal and Social Awareness
competencies.description: Understanding your own feelings and how they affect others, and being aware of the people and world around you

indicators.name: Comprehend my own feelings and their impact on others.
Stay aware of the people and the world around me.

competencies.name: Questioning and Predicting
competencies.description: Asking questions and making guesses about what might happen next based on what you know

indicators.name: Inquire and make predictions based on my knowledge.

competencies.name: Planning and Conducting
competencies.description: Making a plan and doing things to carry out the plan

indicators.name: Create a plan.
Take actions to execute that plan.

competencies.name: Processing and Analyzing Data and Information
competencies.description: Sorting through information and figuring out what it means

indicators.name: Analyze information to understand its meaning.

competencies.name: Evaluating
competencies.description: Checking to see if something is good or not based on specific criteria

indicators.name: Evaluate something to determine its quality using specific criteria.

competencies.name: Applying and Innovating
competencies.description: Using what you know to solve problems in new and creative ways

indicators.name: Apply my knowledge to solve problems in innovative and creative ways.

competencies.name: Significance
competencies.description: Figuring out what's important and why it matters

indicators.name: Determine what is significant and understand its importance.

competencies.name: Evidence
competencies.description: Collecting and using facts to help support an idea or argument

indicators.name: Gather and apply facts to boost an idea or argument.

competencies.name: Continuity and Change
competencies.description: Understanding how things stay the same or are different over time

indicators.name: Understand how things remain constant or change over time.

competencies.name: Cause and Consequence
competencies.description: Figuring out why things happen and what might happen as a result

indicators.name: Analyze why things occur and predict potential outcomes.

competencies.name: Perspective
competencies.description: Seeing things from different points of view to get a better understanding

indicators.name: Consider various perspectives.
Gain a deeper understanding through multiple viewpoints.

competencies.name: Ethical Judgment
competencies.description: Thinking about what's right and wrong and making decisions based on that

indicators.name: Contemplate ethical choices.
Make decisions based on what’s morally right.

competencies.name: Personal Development
competencies.description: Growing and learning to be a better person by being positive, managing emotions, and achieving goals.

indicators.name: Maintain a positive attitude.
Manage emotions effectively.
Reach personal goals.

competencies.name: Questioning and Predicting
competencies.description: Asking questions and making guesses about what might happen next based on what you know

indicators.name: Inquire and ask questions.
Make predictions based on knowledge.

competencies.description: Making a plan and doing things to carry out the plan

indicators.name: Create a plan.
Take actions to execute that plan.

indicators.name: Analyze information to understand its meaning.

indicators.name: Evaluate something to determine its quality using specific criteria.

indicators.name: Apply knowledge to solve problems in innovative and creative ways.

indicators.name: Determine what is significant.
Understand the importance of significant things.

contexts.name: Applied Design, Skills, and Technology
contexts.description: Exploring the practical application of design principles, skills, and technology to create innovative solutions.

contexts.name: Career Education
contexts.description: Preparing students for the workplace and helping them understand how various careers contribute to society.

contexts.name: Arts Education
contexts.description: Encouraging creative expression and understanding through visual arts, music, dance, and drama.

contexts.name: English Language Arts
contexts.description: Developing literacy, communication, and critical thinking skills through the study of language and literature.

contexts.name: Mathematics
contexts.description: Understanding patterns, relations, and functions to solve problems using mathematical reasoning.

contexts.name: Physical and Health Education
contexts.description: Promoting physical fitness, health, and well-being through active living and healthy lifestyle choices.

contexts.name: Science
contexts.description: Investigating natural phenomena through observation, experimentation, and analysis to understand the natural world.

contexts.name: Social Studies
contexts.description: Examining human societies, cultures, and historical events to understand the complexities of the world.
